fields.description:
Hi

We have hit to a problem using EBS volumes with NetApp storage systems.
Problem is that NetApp has maximum volume limit of 500 volumes in one filer. And as Euca creates one volume for each EBS LUN result is that maximum EBS volume count is 499. (one volume is needed as system root volume).

So end users can create only 499 EBS volumes/snapshots.

There is simple work workaround how you can overcome 500 volume limit on Netapp. Only setback is that code has to be changed littlebit.
Simply create one for few bigger volumes where you put all EBS LUNs. And for EBS snapshots clone individual LUNs, not volumes. In this way you do not even need NetApp FlexClone license, what is quite expensive. You can clone luns without that license.

And I would suggest that this should support multiple volumes as this way you can spread EBS volume creation voer multiple aggregates. And that part is more important in Cluster mode.


Here is example how to do it on the filer console with commands and syntaxes.

First I created new empty volume to the aggregate and set correct volume options

eseefil83> vol create lun_test aggr1 500g
Creation of volume 'lun_test' with size 500g on containing aggregate
'aggr1' has completed.
eseefil83> snap sched lun_test 0
eseefil83> snap reserve lun_test 0
eseefil83> vol options lun_test fractional_reserve 0
eseefil83> vol autosize lun_test -m 1t -i 10g on

Then I created two simple 50G luns for this test. Note these are on same volume.

eseefil83> lun create -s 50g -t linux /vol/lun_test/lun1.lun
eseefil83> lun create -s 50g -t linux /vol/lun_test/lun2.lun

eseefil83> lun show  
          /vol/lun_test/lun1.lun        50g (53687091200)   (r/w, online)
          /vol/lun_test/lun2.lun        50g (53687091200)   (r/w, online)

Next step is to create snapshot to that volume. This is because lun clone needs base snapshot for cloning.
And then simply create lun clone what is pointing lun from just created snapshot.

eseefil83> snap create lun_test lunsnap
eseefil83> lun clone create /vol/lun_test/snap1.lun -b /vol/lun_test/lun1.lun lunsnap

As you can see, now we have those to manually created LUNs and one cloned lun. Detailed list of clone shows that it is based on lun in snapshot what we just created. Lun is not yet splitted, only cloned

Also in this point you already can create igroups, lun mappings etc just normal way. Lun is ready to use.

eseefil83> lun show
          /vol/lun_test/lun1.lun        50g (53687091200)   (r/w, online)
          /vol/lun_test/lun2.lun        50g (53687091200)   (r/w, online)
          /vol/lun_test/snap1.lun       50g (53687091200)   (r/w, online)

eseefil83> lun show -v /vol/lun_test/snap1.lun
          /vol/lun_test/snap1.lun       50g (53687091200)   (r/w, online)
                   Serial#: 1k/AO+Bw13e2
                   Backed by: /vol/lun_test/.snapshot/lunsnap/lun1.lun
                   Share: none
                   Space Reservation: enabled
                   Multiprotocol Type: linux
                   Occupied Size:       0 (0)            
                   Creation Time: Thu Feb 14 10:22:41 EET 2013
                   Cluster Shared Volume Information: 0x0 

Splitting clone is simply made using one command. And after that, the snapshot created for clone is now obsole and has to be deleted. Deleting snapshot is really important part. As there can be only 255 snapshots per volume you will run  out of snapshots in notime.

eseefil83> lun clone split start /vol/lun_test/snap1.lun 
eseefil83> Thu Feb 14 10:23:43 EET [eseefil83:lun.clone.split.started:info]: Clone split was started on LUN /vol/lun_test/snap1.lun.  
eseefil83> Thu Feb 14 10:23:49 EET [eseefil83:lun.clone.split.completed:info]: Clone split was completed on LUN /vol/lun_test/snap1.lun.  

eseefil83> snap delete lun_test lunsnap

Final check, cloned lun is not backed up anymore, so it is now successfully splitted.

eseefil83> lun show -v /vol/lun_test/snap1.lun            
          /vol/lun_test/snap1.lun       50g (53687091200)   (r/w, online)
                   Serial#: 1k/AO+Bw13e2
                   Share: none
                   Space Reservation: enabled
                   Multiprotocol Type: linux
                   Occupied Size:       0 (0)            
                   Creation Time: Thu Feb 14 10:22:41 EET 2013
                   Cluster Shared Volume Information: 0x0 
eseefil83> lun show
          /vol/lun_test/lun1.lun        50g (53687091200)   (r/w, online)
          /vol/lun_test/lun2.lun        50g (53687091200)   (r/w, online)
          /vol/lun_test/snap1.lun       50g (53687091200)   (r/w, online)

Questions, ask…

-	J
